comments_since_last_sample.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*
landwehr is just mad that she was too late to join the wehrmacht
Vaccines save lives.... showers with gas takes lives.  Morons.
The Nazis calling a life saving vaccine racist?

Republicans are the most fucked up people on Earth. There's no comparison. It's a shame we have this strange group of people in this country that doesn't appear to exist anywhere else in the world. It's some odd cultural group that cannot coexist with the world.

What are Republicans expectations of this world? I'm really curious. Do they honestly think they're a competitive group of people who can uplift the country to a level that makes us challenge our fiercest economic, military, or technologically developed competitors?

Do you Republicans seriously think you know anything about anything? It's a bizarre thing to observe such dumb people try to act like they're on some main stage when countries like China could flick them away like a booger. If it weren't for common sense people holding this place together we wouldn't have a seat at the table.

Republicans know that deep down. They're non competitors.
It’s a popular trend these days.  They have a vested interest in getting covid and spreading it to others due to a crackpot conspiracy theory.
If it wasn't for the use of buzzwords some of these people wouldn't be able to communicate with their base at all.
